item.title: Go CommonTechniques
item.description: Data Conversion 1)int to string s := strconv.Itoa(i) s := strconv.FormatInt(int64(i), 10) 2)int64 to string i := int64(123) s := strconv.FormatInt(i, 10) 3)string to int i, err := strconv.Atoi(s) 4)string to int64 i, err := strconv.ParseInt(s, 10, 64) 5)float to string v := 3.1415926535 s1 := strconv.FormatFloat(v, 'E', -1, 32)//float32s2 := strconv.FormatFloat(v, 'E', -1, 64)//float64 6)string to float s := "3.1415926535" v1, err := strconv.ParseFloat(v, 32) v2, err := strconv.ParseFloat(v, 64) Float format a:=strconv.

item.title: Go Install
item.description: Golang Installation And configuration Windows 1.Download and Installation 2.Set GOPATH in user environment variable settings and global environment variable settings For me: C:\work\Go 3.Verify the installation Command Line: go version 4.Open the GOMOD Command Line: go env -w GO111MODULE=on 5.Create a golang project by vscode and config the setting json { "version": "0.2.0", "configurations": [{ "name": "{yourprojectname}", "type": "go", "request": "launch", "mode": "auto", "program": "${fileDirname}", "env": { "GOPATH": "{your GOPATH}", "GOROOT": "{your GOROOT}" }, "args": [], //"showLog": true } ] } Linux 1.
